name: d3.packEnclose
description: Visual explanation of the circle packing enclosure algorithm — how d3 finds the smallest circle containing a set of circles.
data_shape: Array of circles with x, y, r.
key_patterns: d3.packEnclose(circles) returns enclosing circle {x, y, r}
Animated: show algorithm iterations adding circles one by one
Enclosing circle updates with each addition
notes: Educational visualization of d3.packEnclose algorithm. Shows iterative computation of minimum enclosing circle. Good for algorithm explanation articles.

name: Centerline Labeling
description: Technique for placing text labels along the centerline of irregular shapes (like US states).
key_patterns: Compute medial axis / centerline of polygon
Use Voronoi of boundary points to approximate medial axis
Place text along longest internal line segment
Rotate text to follow centerline direction
notes: Finding optimal label placement inside irregular polygons. More sophisticated than centroid placement — follows shape's medial axis for better fit.

name: Methods of Comparison, Compared
description: Analysis of different visualization methods for comparing datasets — superposition, juxtaposition, explicit encoding.
data_shape: Same dataset shown in multiple chart types.
key_patterns: Superposition: overlay two series on same axes
Explicit encoding: show the difference directly
notes: Essay showing the same data visualized three ways. Educational — demonstrates trade-offs between comparison methods.

name: Predator and Prey
description: Lotka-Volterra population dynamics simulation showing predator-prey oscillations.
key_patterns: Euler or RK4 integration of Lotka-Volterra ODEs
dx/dt = ax - bxy, dy/dt = cxy - dy
Two lines: prey (grows, eaten) and predator (eats, dies)
Phase portrait: predator vs prey (no time axis)
Sliders for parameters a, b, c, d
notes: Numerical ODE simulation. Two views: time series (x=time) and phase portrait (x=prey, y=predator showing limit cycles). Interactive parameter sliders.
